intro: Tetracme leptopoda, commonly known as the slender-stemmed tetracme, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have four or five petals. Tetracme leptopoda is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
